meanings.definition: The severity or harmfulness of a disease or poison.
meanings.sent1: The virulence of the virus led to many people getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was concerned about the virulence of the new strain of bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The virulence of the poison was so strong that even a tiny amount could be dangerous.
meanings.sent4: The virulence of the disease spread quickly through the community like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The virulence of the venomous snake's bite was evident in the rapid swelling and pain.

meanings.definition: The quality of being actively poisonous or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The virulence of the chemical made it unsafe for human consumption.
meanings.sent2: The plant's virulence was evident in its ability to cause skin irritation.
meanings.sent3: The virulence of the cleaning product was so strong that it could strip paint off surfaces.
meanings.sent4: The virulence of the spider's venom paralyzed its prey within seconds.
meanings.sent5: The virulence of the pesticide was effective in eliminating the insect infestation.

meanings.definition: The intensity of a pathogen's ability to cause disease.
meanings.sent1: The virulence of the bacteria strain resulted in a widespread outbreak.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the virulence of the virus to understand its impact on the population.
meanings.sent3: The virulence of the flu virus made everyone in the office sick.
meanings.sent4: The virulence of the pathogen was evident in the rapid onset of symptoms.
meanings.sent5: The virulence of the parasite caused severe damage to the host's internal organs.
